title: rclone mount has zero blocks available
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
```
>>> import os
>>> os.statvfs("/Users/andrew/rclone-mnt/google/")
posix.statvfs_result(f_bsize=4096, f_frsize=4096, f_blocks=0, f_bfree=4275873052, f_bavail=0, f_files=1000000000, f_ffree=1000000000, f_favail=1000000000, f_flag=2, f_namemax=255)
```
f_bavail being 0 confuses software like https://github.com/borgbackup/borg/blob/3bdfa869d62c6f9d5bd87db493e8d96433810117/src/borg/repository.py#L646

I cannot figure out which layer the problem comes from. ðŸ˜• 

#### What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
rclone v1.41
- os/arch: darwin/amd64
- go version: go1.10.1

(cannot reproduce with latest beta because of #2355)

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
macOS Mojave Developer Preview 2 10.14 Beta (18A314h)

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone mount --vfs-cache-mode writes --no-modtime google: -vv ./rclone-mnt/google

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

2018/06/20 20:01:54 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.41" starting with parameters ["rclone" "mount" "--vfs-cache-mode" "writes" "--no-modtime" "google:" "-vv" "./rclone-mnt/google"]
